qas.question: What year was the Canal de la Bruche added?
What kind of tourism attracts tourists yearly?
In what year was the Canal de la Bruche closed?
In what year was the Canal du Rhone au Rhine opened?
Which is newer, the Canal de la Marne au Rhin or the Grand Canal d'Alsace?

plausible_answers.text: Canal de la Marne au Rhin

qas.question: Which canal attracts the most tourists?
Which canal attracts the fewest tourists?

context: Being a city on the Ill and close to the <a2_0>Rhine<a2_0/>, Strasbourg has always been an important centre of fluvial navigation, as is attested by archeological findings. In <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>1682<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> the Canal de la Bruche was added to the river navigations, initially to provide transport for sandstone from quarries in the Vosges for use in the fortification of the city. That canal has since closed, but the subsequent Canal du Rhone au Rhine, <b6_0>Canal de la Marne au Rhin<b6_0/> and <b5_0><b7_0>Grand Canal d'Alsace<b7_0/><b5_0/> are still in use, as is the important activity of the Port autonome de Strasbourg. <a1_0>Water tourism<a1_0/> inside the city proper attracts hundreds of thousands of tourists yearly.
